title: Tech Portal
description: Portal for technicians to post current openings at their stores or trade shifts.
specialNotes: For future development, features still being considered.

title: Register Functions
description: An overview with an interactive module for understanding the basic register UI as well as a brief overview of the essential functions.
specialNotes: Under development - a suggestion feature for techs to contribute lesser known tricks of the trade.

title: Intercom Plus Module
description: A series of modules to understand the UI and essential functions within Intercom+ such as understanding the patient profile, prescription entry, flowometer, and billing and adjudication tips.
specialNotes: This will be the largest feature of the site and require constant addition, also debating on gifs versus interactive simulated UI. Long-term, may add a special billing and adjudication section for techs to search by state to get tips on processing certain insurance cards or third party rejections and overrides.

title: Storenet
description: A quick rundown of the most common resources needed in Storenet for pharmacy techs and how to find them.
specialNotes: As my knowledge is somewhat limited and Storenet can change frequently, this may contain very rudimentary knowledge at the start.

title: AS400
description: Common operations pharmacy technicians use in AS400 such as ordering, returns, recalls, salvage, item movement, etc.
specialNotes: May combine this module with the telxon module as the system is the same, only slight differences navigation. Will be expanded upon further research of general operations.

title: General Pharmacy Operations
description: A hub for other techs to contribute methodologies and organizational tips that have helped their general workflow, coworker relations, and patient relations.
specialNotes: Will require further development and back-end implementation, debating on exact functionality, i.e. forum-style or simple categorized tips manually added for better control over content.
